in a way that consists of or relates to syllables: The words are set to music syllabically. The findings indicate that even young readers analyze words syllabically.
More examplesFewer examplesLoanwords are transcribed syllabically in the same way.At this stage of schooling, beginning readers were not syllabically decoding printed words.The text is treated syllabically, and this influences both the rhythm and the melody of the music.The poetry is set syllabically, so each word (or syllable) is clearly heard.
